intro: Acridocarpus alopecurus var. machaeropterus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved acridocarpus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It often grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
